content.description: This route starts at the bottom of a prominent arete. climb just to the right up steep lower section to the face above. it shares and anchor with Humanity Against Gravity (right)
content.location: furtherest left route on split rock.

content.description: Perfect hands for 20 feet leads to some awkward climbing to top anchors in the shrubs to the left.  You can also finish straight up from the crack to bolted anchors over the lip.
content.protection: Gear to three inches, optional #4 or #5 cam.

content.description:
Move up a ledgy start to establish yourself in the crack. Once in the crack there are solid jams that narrow down to fingertips at the top. Pull onto the sloped ledge above & run it out to the anchor.

The route name may be incorrect, I could not find any info on it. surely it has been climbed before though
content.protection: Solid pro after the easy ledge start, two bolt anchor at the top shared with Ward

content.description: Somewhere underneath the moss is nice roc and several bolts. this climb starts just left of the large crack in split rock's main face. climb up and left to the anchors shared by unnamed route to the left
content.location: First route to the right of split crack

content.description: Climb vertical seams using counter pressure to the anchors.
content.location: first route to the right of the obvious4  split crack in the middle of the wall

content.description: Climb out of the pod, and through a couple of bulges with some interesting jams/moves, then enjoy the easier finish.
content.location: To the right of split wall. Look for the large pod (often wet) and a single bolt.

content.description: Starts off on a broken under cling flake on the right side of the wall and goes up to a low angle slab about 2/3 of the way up.
content.location: Furthest right bolted route on Split rock.  Follows the right arête up to the slab before the chains.
